thread.title: Baldwin Wallace hosts Wilmington in 38th Annual Lee Tressel Shrine Classic: Local D2, D3 Football 2015
thread.title_full: Baldwin Wallace hosts Wilmington in 38th Annual Lee Tressel Shrine Classic: Local D2, D3 Football 2015

author: Branson Wright, The Plain Dealer
title: Baldwin Wallace hosts Wilmington in 38th Annual Lee Tressel Shrine Classic: Local D2, D3 Football 2015
text:
Comments 
CLEVELAND, Ohio - Heidelberg (2-3) waltzed its way to a 45-point victory last week over Muskingum and outgained the Muskies by nearly 300 yards. 
But none of that matters at 1:30 p.m. on Saturday when Heidelberg hosts Mount Union (5-0) at Hoernemann Stadium in Tiffin, Ohio because the Purple Raiders are one of the top offensive and defensive teams in Division III. 
Mount Union is No. 1 in the nation in pass defense (70.6 yds/game) and No. 1 in total defense (134.4 yds/game). The Raiders have allowed only 14 points this season. The offense averages 55.4 per game. 
Plus, the Raiders have not lost to Heidelberg since 1988. 
Online Coverage: Live Stats | LIVE WDPN Audio | LIVE WRMU Audio | Live Video 
Baldwin Wallace (3-2) will host Wilmington College (1-4) at 1 :30 p.m. Saturday on Tressel Field at The George Finnie Stadium in Berea. 
The Yellow Jackets will vie for their third straight victory and seventh straight over Wilmington. Saturday is also the 38th annual Lee Tressel Shrine Classic. Partial gate proceeds will benefit the Shriners. 
Listen to the game here. 
Case Western Reserve (4-1) will take its four-game winning streak on the road for a 7 p.m. game at Geneva College (2-3) . Check here for the live video. 
The Spartans are on such a scoring pace that they have scored 224 points through five games, and that's more than the team scored in all of 2013 (182 points) and 2014 (220 points) seasons. 
Here are the remaining games involving local Division II teams on Saturday: Concord (4-1) at Notre Dame (1-5), Noon, Audio Hillsdale (1-5) at Ashland (5-0), 1 p.m., Audio Lake Erie College (1-5) at Saginaw Valley (0-6), 7 p.m.; Live statistics Wayne State (2-4) at Walsh (1-5), 6 p.m.; Live stats 
Here are the remaining games involving local Division III teams on Saturday: John Carroll (4-1) at Marietta (1-4), 1:30 p.m., Audio Oberlin (2-4) at The College of Wooster (1-4), 7 p.m., Live video
